answers.answer: I had them and all I could so was tylenol cold rag over my eyes and dark room...it would ease it off enough to manage
I would take Tylenol n get comfy, wrap something tight around my head cover my eyes n sleep, by the time I wake up its gone

I find that when I'm even slightly dehydrated I get headaches. It can get especially bad now because I'm breastfeeding.Keep your eye on the headaches because a headache that doesn't go away like that could be a sign of preeclampsia.

question: Hey so I posted on I think Friday that I keep getting cluster headaches/migraines well I still have it now, so tday is the 4th day of this, nothing is budging it :-( tried paracetamol, cold flannel on forehead and neck, drinking plenty of water, I stayed in bed in the dark for nearly all Saturday and yesterday. and I woke up thismorn n its still going strong. I have a doctors appointment at 12 today. but I was just wondering if anyone else has had this during pregnancy? I have suffered with these for years and had all my wisdom teeth out and changed my pill and it seemed to help for about 1yearuntil now.  I am 18+4 today
title: headache hell :-(
